project.name: gentoo-alt
project.description: Provide Gentoo-way solutions for non-GNU/Linux platforms.

longdescription.p: Gentoo-alt is a top-level project that manages efforts to support alternate Gentoo platforms and runtime environments. In many ways, gentoo-alt represents the "cutting edge" work that is being done to expand the capabilities and potential of Gentoo in general.

To avoid that the missing of one of the devs makes difficult maintaining the project, all the technical documentation about Gentoo/ALT projects must be written and published, so that they are available to whoever wants to help.

task.name: No GNU extensions
task.description: Make sure that GNU extensions are not used by portage

longdescription.p: Many ebuilds used to use GNU extensions to commands and other syntaxes that are not usable on BSD-like systems.
What we need to do is make sure that all the GNU-isms are avoided, using just a common set of POSIX options that are available on other systems.

milestone.description: Avoid usage of /bin/false as shell for enewuser
Avoid usage of GNUisms in cp options (like -d and -a)
Avoid usage of root:root in chowns
Avoid usage of cp --parents in favor of treecopy
Make sure nothing links to -ldl unconditionally

reference.bug: ebuilds should not use GNU specific cp options like -a or -d
chown root:root will be ignored on Gentoo/FreeBSD (and Gentoo/Darwin)
cp --parents option should be replaced with treecopy function
Linking to -ldl should never happen unconditionally

longdescription.p: Currently the sandbox, used by portage to block ebuilds from editing the live filesystem during compile and install stages, works only on Linux systems that uses GNU libc.
To be able to use sandbox on BSD systems, it's necessary clean up the code to be more platform-independant, and provide aliases and replacement for the functions used that are glibc specific.
